author: lightclient
content:
two quick questions:
- the p2p spec says CLs only need the last 5 months of block data, which clients actually prune block data older?
- does anyone have a rough idea of how much space the beacon chain takes up (not including state, indexes, etc) - just block data?

author: tersec
content: For the first point, Nimbus prunes by default

author: manunlp
content: For the first point, Prysm prunes if the `--beacon-db-pruning` option is set. (no pruning by default)

author: .paulharris
content:
teku's default behaviour is to prune older blocks
I'm not sure the total size of just block data, i think some clients store blinded blocks and rely on the EL for payloads (i could be wrong on this) which would have a big impact on storage.
